channel.title: WinVista released to public (Now legal to download)!
channel.description: [url=http://www.microsoft.com/windowsvista/getready/preview.mspx]http://www.microsoft.com/windowsvista/getready/preview.mspx[/url] Download + install it, and it will be valid until Jan, 2007.

item.title: WinVista released to public (Now legal to download)!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:2, topic:3760”]Still buggy as hell as it used too?

*Gates is a whore for money… *[/quote]
Yup. Ever since IBM sold him dos, he’s been trying to take over the world. I think he might be Brain from that show Pinky and the Brain. This is how they take over in the next episode. lol

item.title: WinVista released to public (Now legal to download)!
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

I’m using build 5834 right now (The one right before the one in my post), and after about 10 minutes of tweaking it runs as well as XP (At leaste on my PC), but looks a lot better.

Go to http://www.vistaforums.com/Forum/Default.aspx for tweaking instructions.

My main complaint is that every time you open an .exe file it asks you of you really want to run it. To fix that, go to Start > All Programs > Accessories > Right-click “Command Prompt” > Run as Administrator > and copy + paste â€œC:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe /k %windir%\System32\reg.exe ADD HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System /v EnableLUA /t REG_DWORD /d 1 /fâ€ (No quotes) and press enter.

Read full topic
